intro: Rubus hirtiformis, commonly known as the hairy raspberry, is a species of bramble native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other raspberries and blackberries.
